<td valign="top"> <p style="font-size:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; border-bottom:1.00pt solid #999999; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>IAN D. CLOUGH Age:
53</b></font></p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>Director since: 2016</b></p> <p style="font-size:6pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>Audit Committee</b></p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>Finance Committee</b></p></td></tr>
</tbody></table> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Mr. Clough has served as the Managing Director, Network, Logistics and Transport at DHL Supply Chain since June 2018. From May 2016
to June 2018, he was an independent management consultant. He previously served as Managing Director of International Europe for TNT Express N.V. (a Netherlands-based international courier delivery services company) from April 2014 to May 2016 and
also served as a Member of the companys Management Board during that time. Previously, Mr. Clough served as Chief Executive Officer of DHL Express (USA), part of the Deutsche Post DHL Group from 2009 to 2014. Mr. Clough has
experience in general management as well as in leading business turnarounds. He also brings to the Board deep transportation and logistics industry insight and knowledge as well as experience in leading international businesses. </p>
<p style="font-size:10pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="line-height:3.5pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1.00pt solid #000000"> </p> <p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>

Age: 57</b></font></p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>Director since: 2014</b></p> <p style="font-size:6pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>Compensation Committee (Chair)</b></p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>Finance Committee</b></p></td></tr>
</tbody></table> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Ms. Docherty is the former Chief Executive Officer of Canyon Ranch, a company that promotes healthy living and provides luxury spa
vacations on land and at sea, having served in this position from May 2015 through August 2019. Previously, Ms. Docherty was the General Motors Vice President with profit and loss and operating responsibility as President and Managing Director
for Chevrolet and Cadillac Europe, General Motors Company (an automobile manufacturing company), having served in this position from December 2011 through September 2013. Ms. Docherty previously served as General Motors Companys Vice
President of International Operations Sales, Marketing and Aftersales from 2010 to 2011 and Vice President U.S. Sales, Service and Marketing from 2009 to 2010. In these roles, Ms. Docherty developed executive-level experience in international
business operations, technology, strategic planning, business transformation, regulatory matters and talent management, as well as significant experience in consumer sales and marketing, which benefit the Brinks Board. </p>
<p style="font-size:10pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="line-height:3.5pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1.00pt solid #000000"> </p>

<td valign="top"> <p style="font-size:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; border-bottom:1.00pt solid #999999; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>REGINALD D.
HEDGEBETH Age: 52</b></font></p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>Director since: 2011</b></p> <p style="font-size:6pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>Audit Committee (Chair)</b></p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>Corporate Governance Committee</b></p></td></tr>
</tbody></table> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Mr. Hedgebeth has served as the Executive Vice President, General Counsel and Chief Administrative Officer of Marathon Oil
Corporation (an independent global exploration and production company), since April 2017. Mr. Hedgebeth previously served as the General Counsel, Corporate Secretary and Chief Ethics &amp; Compliance Officer of Spectra Energy Corp (a
natural gas, liquids and crude oil infrastructure company with gathering and processing, transmission, storage and distribution operations throughout North America) from 2009 to March 2017. Mr. Hedgebeth also served as General Counsel for
Spectra Energy Partners, LP (a Delaware Master Limited Partnership formed by Spectra Energy Corp to own and operate natural gas, liquids and oil transportation and storage assets) from 2014 to March 2017. From 2005 to 2009, he served as Senior Vice
President, General Counsel and Secretary of Circuit City Stores, Inc. Mr. Hedgebeth brings to the Board his extensive experience in legal and compliance matters, including securities, corporate governance, ethics, business development and
financing, intellectual property and government regulatory matters. He also contributes executive-level experience in government relations and advocacy, internal controls, strategy, supply chain and procurement, risk management and corporate
restructuring developed through his work for Marathon Oil Corporation, Spectra Energy Corp and Circuit City Stores, Inc. </p> <p style="font-size:10pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<p style="line-height:3.5pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1.00pt solid #000000"> </p> <p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>

<td valign="top"> <p style="font-size:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; border-bottom:1.00pt solid #999999; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>DAN R. HENRY Age:
54</b></font></p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>Director since: 2017</b></p> <p style="font-size:6pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>Compensation Committee</b></p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>Finance Committee</b></p></td></tr>
</tbody></table> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Mr. Henry is the Chief Executive Officer, President and a member of the Board of Directors of Green Dot Corporation (a financial
technology and bank holding company) having been appointed in March 2020. From 2014 to 2020, Mr. Henry was a private investor and advisor. He previously served as Chief Executive Officer of NetSpend, a leading provider of prepaid debit cards
for personal &amp; commercial use, from 2008 to 2014. Prior to that, he served as President and Chief Operating Officer of Euronet, a global leader in processing secure electronic financial transactions from 1994 to 2006. He was also a <font style="white-space:nowrap">co-founder</font> of Euronet and served on its board until January 2008. Mr. Henry currently serves on the Board of Directors of Paysign, Inc. (a payment solution provider) and is a member of the Board of Directors of
a number of privately held companies, including Rx Savings Solutions, card.com, Dama Financial, and Align Income Share Funding, in the payments and technology industries. Mr. Henry is a seasoned financial services industry entrepreneur who
brings valuable senior leadership experience and insight to the Board. </p> <p style="font-size:10pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<p style="line-height:3.5pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1.00pt solid #000000"> </p>

<p align="right" style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>PROPOSAL NO. 1ELECTION OF DIRECTORS </b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">

<td valign="bottom">  </td>
<td valign="top"> <p style="font-size:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; border-bottom:1.00pt solid #999999; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>MICHAEL J. HERLING
Age: 62</b></font></p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>Director since: 2009</b></p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>Chairman of the Board</b></p>
<p style="font-size:6pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>Compensation Committee</b></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>Corporate Governance Committee</b></p></td></tr>
</tbody></table> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Mr. Herling is a founding partner of Finn Dixon &amp; Herling LLP (a law firm that provides corporate, transactional,
securities, investment management, lending, tax, executive compensation and benefits and litigation counsel). He has held that position since 1987. He currently serves as the Chair of the Board of Trustees of Colgate University. The Board benefits
from Mr. Herlings entrepreneurial experience as a founding partner of Finn Dixon &amp; Herling and his extensive legal experience representing corporate and institutional clients and their boards of directors with a focus on
strategic initiatives and complex transactions such as mergers and acquisitions, securities offerings and financings. Through his varied Board experience, Mr. Herling has gained experience and knowledge in corporate governance and compliance,
risk oversight, audit, succession planning and executive compensation matters. </p> <p style="font-size:10pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<p style="line-height:3.5pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1.00pt solid #000000"> </p> <p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">

<td width="18%"></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="1%"></td>
<td width="81%"></td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<td valign="top">
<img alt="LOGO" src="g867884g53r54.jpg"/>
</td>
<td valign="bottom">  </td>
<td valign="top"> <p style="font-size:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; border-bottom:1.00pt solid #999999; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>DOUGLAS A. PERTZ
Age: 65</b></font></p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>Director since: 2016</b></p> <p style="font-size:6pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt"> </p></td></tr>
</tbody></table> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Douglas A. Pertz has served as the President and Chief Executive Officer and a director of The Brinks Company since June 2016. From
April 2013 to May 2016, Mr. Pertz was the President and Chief Executive Officer and a director of Recall Holdings Limited (a global provider of digital and physical information management and security services) and from 2011 to 2013, was a
partner with Bolder Capital, LLC (a private equity firm specializing in acquisitions and investments in middle market companies). Prior to 2011, Mr. Pertz also held positions of President, Chief Executive Officer and Chairman of the Board of
IMC Global (now Mosaic Company) and Culligan Water Technologies. He currently serves as a member of the Board of Directors of Advance Auto Parts, Inc. (an automotive aftermarket parts provider). During the past five years, Mr. Pertz served on
the Board of Directors of Recall Holdings Limited. Mr. Pertz brings to the Board significant chief executive officer experience, including leadership of large, multinational companies and expertise in the areas of finance, mergers, acquisitions
and divestitures, developed during his tenure at several investment firms and operating companies. His operational expertise in the areas of secure storage,
<font style="white-space:nowrap"><font style="white-space:nowrap">business-to-business</font></font> services and branch-based, route-based logistics companies are highly valuable to the Brinks Board. </p>
<p style="font-size:10pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="line-height:3.5pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1.00pt solid #000000"> </p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">

<img alt="LOGO" src="g867884g23_51.jpg"/>
</sub>    2020 Proxy Statement  </i></td>

<center><div align="left" style="width:8.5in">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>The Brinks Company </b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr>
<td width="18%"></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="1%"></td>
<td width="81%"></td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<td valign="top">
<img alt="LOGO" src="g867884g22t71.jpg"/>
</td>
<td valign="bottom">  </td>
<td valign="top"> <p style="font-size:10pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; border-bottom:1.00pt solid #999999; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>GEORGE I.
STOECKERT Age: 71</b></font></p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>Director since: 2016</b></p> <p style="font-size:6pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>Audit Committee</b></p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>Corporate Governance Committee (Chair)</b></p></td></tr>
</tbody></table> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Mr. Stoeckert has been a private investor and advisor since 2011. He served as Interim President and Chief Executive Officer of The
Brinks Company from May 2016 to June 2016, and previously served as President of North America and Internet Solutions at Dun &amp; Bradstreet from 2009 to 2011. Prior to that, he held various senior leadership positions at Automatic Data
Processing, Inc. (ADP), including President of Employer Services International and President of the Major Accounts Services Division. Before joining ADP, Mr. Stoeckert served as President of the Insurance Management Services
Division and Senior Vice President of Strategy and Corporate Development at Ryder System, Inc. Mr. Stoeckert currently serves on the Board of Directors of Theragenics, Inc. (a medical device company). He also serves as a Senior Advisor to the
private equity firm, Bridge Growth Partners, LLC. During the past five years, Mr. Stoeckert has also served as a director of Onvia, Inc. (a business intelligence company), and Capital Re Corporation (a financial guarantee company).
Mr. Stoeckert has a broad domestic and international business background, including strategic planning, finance, technology and operational expertise, and brings to the Board significant related-industry experience from his leadership roles at
ADP and Ryder System, Inc. </p> <p style="font-size:10pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="line-height:3.5pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1.00pt solid #000000"> </p>
<p style="font-size:24pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p><center> <p style="line-height:6.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1.00pt solid #0033a0;width:63%"> </p></center>
<p align="center" style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS RECOMMENDS THAT </b></font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>THE SHAREHOLDERS VOTE FOR THE NINE </b></font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>NOMINEES NAMED IN THIS PROXY STATEMENT </b></font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>FOR ELECTION AS DIRECTORS. </b></font></p> <p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p><center>
<p style="line-height:6.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1.00pt solid #0033a0;width:63%"> </p></center>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">

<td style="padding-bottom:2pt ;" valign="top"><i>  <sub style="font-size:85%; vertical-align:bottom">

<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p></body></html><html><head></head><body><h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<center><div align="left" style="width:8.5in">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>The Brinks Company </b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:24pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><a name="toc867884_17"></a>PROPOSAL NO. 2ADVISORY VOTE TO APPROVE
NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICER COMPENSATION </font></p>
<p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p><div style="position:relative;float:left; width:48%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Company is seeking shareholder approval of an advisory resolution to approve the compensation of the Companys
named executive officers as disclosed in this proxy statement. </p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Company maintains a pay for performance compensation philosophy and an executive compensation
program that is designed to: </p> <p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="34"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="19"><font color="#0033a0"></font></td>
<td valign="top" width="1"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top">incentivize and reward executives who contribute to the achievement of the Companys business objectives and the creation of long-term shareholder value, without encouraging unnecessary and excessive risks;
</td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="34"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="19"><font color="#0033a0"></font></td>
<td valign="top" width="1"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top">attract, retain and motivate talented executives to perform at the highest level and contribute significantly to the Companys success; </td></tr></tbody></table>
<p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="34"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="19"><font color="#0033a0"></font></td>
<td valign="top" width="1"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top">align the interests of the named executive officers with those of shareholders through equity-based LTI awards and robust stock ownership guidelines; and </td></tr></tbody></table>
<p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="34"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="19"><font color="#0033a0"></font></td>
<td valign="top" width="1"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top">provide an appropriate and balanced mix of short-term and long-term compensation elements. </td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">In deciding how to vote on
this proposal, the Board asks that you consider the following key points with respect to our executive compensation program: </p> <p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="34"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="19"><font color="#0033a0"></font></td>
<td valign="top" width="1"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top"><i>We pay for performance</i>. The 2019 compensation awarded to the named executive officers reflects the compensation principles listed above as well as the Companys results for the year. Annual incentive awards
were paid according to the Companys achievement of <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font> operating profit, revenue and free cash flow results as well as individual performance. LTI awards consisted of Internal Metric PSU, Relative
TSR PSU, Stock Option and RSU awards to ensure continued alignment between executive officer compensation and long-term shareholder value. Mr. Pertzs entire 2019 LTI award was provided in performance-based equity  50% in Internal
Metric PSUs, 25% Relative TSR PSUs and 25% Stock Options. He received no RSUs in 2019.
</td></tr></tbody></table></div><div style="position:relative;float:left; margin-left:3%; width:49%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="34"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="19"><font color="#0033a0"></font></td>
<td valign="top" width="1"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top"><i>The Compensation Committee regularly reviews the Companys executive compensation program</i>. The Compensation Committee reviews the Companys executive compensation program to ensure that it is aligned
with the competitive market and reflects the compensation principles listed above. </td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="34"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="19"><font color="#0033a0"></font></td>
<td valign="top" width="1"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top"><i>The executive compensation program is designed to align the interests of executives and shareholders.</i> The LTI program is designed to ensure strong alignment with shareholder value through payment in shares of
Brinks Common Stock. The Compensation Committee uses a focused peer group that includes companies in similar industries, with similar characteristics to Brinks as its reference point, as well as relevant survey data, as needed, for
assessing executive officer compensation against the market. </td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="34"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="19"><font color="#0033a0"></font></td>
<td valign="top" width="1"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top"><i>There are no tax <font style="white-space:nowrap">gross-ups</font> upon a change in control for executive officers and no excessive perquisites</i>. None of the Companys executive officers is subject to any
agreement or policy that provides excise tax <font style="white-space:nowrap">gross-ups</font> upon a change in control. We provide limited perquisites to our executive officers. </td></tr></tbody></table>
<p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="34"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="19"><font color="#0033a0"></font></td>
<td valign="top" width="1"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top"><i>The Compensation Committee uses an independent compensation consultant</i>. The Compensation Committees consultant reports directly to the Committee and does not perform any work for management. In performing
its services, the consultant works closely with management at the Committees direction. </td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="34"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="19"><font color="#0033a0"></font></td>
<td valign="top" width="1"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top"><i>We engage with our shareholders</i>. The Company maintains a shareholder outreach program to connect with shareholders throughout the year to gain insight into shareholders perspectives on key governance and
compensation issues. </td></tr></tbody></table></div><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt"> </div>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr>
<td width="96%"></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="1%"></td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td></td></tr>
<tr style="font-size:1pt">
<td height="2" style="BORDER-RIGHT:1.00pt solid #0033a0; padding-left:8pt"> </td>
<td colspan="4" height="2"></td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<td align="right" style="padding-bottom:2pt ;BORDER-RIGHT:1.00pt solid #0033a0; padding-left:8pt" valign="top"><i><sub style="font-size:85%; vertical-align:bottom">
<img alt="LOGO" src="g867884g23_51.jpg"/>
</sub>    2020 Proxy Statement  </i></td>
<td valign="bottom"> </td>
<td style="padding-bottom:2pt ;" valign="bottom"><b> </b></td>
<td align="right" style="padding-bottom:2pt ;" valign="bottom"><b>  25</b></td>
<td nowrap="" style="padding-bottom:2pt ;" valign="bottom"><b> </b></td></tr></tbody></table>

<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p></body></html><html><head></head><body><h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<center><div align="left" style="width:8.5in">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>The Brinks Company </b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p><div style="position:relative;float:left; width:48%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="34"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="19"><font color="#0033a0"></font></td>
<td valign="top" width="1"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top"><i>The Company may take advantage of tax deductibility for compensation of executives to the extent 162(m) Transition Relief is available</i>. The Board and shareholders previously approved an LTI program that is
intended to permit the Company, if appropriate and if permitted, to take tax deductions for payments under Section 162(m) of the Code where 162(m) Transition Relief remains available. </td></tr></tbody></table>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">You are encouraged to review the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the compensation tables and the accompanying narrative on pages 27 through 59 of this proxy
statement, which provide a comprehensive review of the Companys executive compensation program and its elements, objectives and rationale. </p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">In accordance with
Section 14A of the Exchange Act rules, shareholders are asked to approve the following <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-binding</font> resolution: </p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:20pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>RESOLVED, that the Companys shareholders approve, on a <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-binding</font> advisory basis, the
compensation of the
</b></p></div><div style="position:relative;float:left; margin-left:3%; width:49%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:20pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>
Companys named executive officers, as disclosed in the Proxy Statement for the 2020 Annual Meeting of Shareholders pursuant to the compensation disclosure rules of the Securities and
Exchange Commission, including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the 2019 Summary Compensation Table, the other related tables and the accompanying narrative on pages 27 through 59. </b></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Company holds this <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-binding</font> advisory vote annually. The shareholder vote on this proposal will be <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-binding</font> on the Company and the Board and will not be construed as overruling a decision by the Company or the Board. However, the Board and the Compensation Committee value the opinions that shareholders express
in their votes and will consider the outcome of the vote when making future executive compensation decisions as they deem appropriate.
</p></div><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt"> </div>
<p style="font-size:24pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p><center>
<p style="line-height:6.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1.00pt solid #0033a0;width:63%"> </p></center>
<p align="center" style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS RECOMMENDS THAT </b></font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>SHAREHOLDERS VOTE FOR THE APPROVAL OF THE </b></font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b><font style="white-space:nowrap">NON-BINDING</font> RESOLUTION ON NAMED </b></font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>EXECUTIVE OFFICER COMPENSATION. </b></font></p> <p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p><center>
<p style="line-height:6.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1.00pt solid #0033a0;width:63%"> </p></center>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p>

<td style="padding-bottom:2pt ;" valign="top"><b>26  </b></td>
<td style=" BORDER-LEFT:1.00pt solid #0033a0" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td style="padding-bottom:2pt ;" valign="top"><i>  <sub style="font-size:85%; vertical-align:bottom">
<img alt="LOGO" src="g867884g23_51.jpg"/>
</sub>    2020 Proxy Statement</i></td></tr></tbody></table>
</div></center>
<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p></body></html><html><head></head><body><h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<center><div align="left" style="width:8.5in">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>The Brinks Company </b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:24pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><a name="toc867884_18"></a>COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS </font></p>
<p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:14pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b><a name="toc867884_19"></a>Executive Summary </b></p> <p style="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #0033a0"> </p>
<p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p><div style="position:relative;float:left; width:48%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b><i>2020 CD&amp;A </i></b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">This Compensation Discussion and Analysis (CD&amp;A) and the executive compensation tables that follow describe the compensation of the Companys named
executive officers: </p> <p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="34"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="19"><font color="#0033a0"></font></td>
<td valign="top" width="1"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top">Douglas A. Pertz, President, Chief Executive Officer and President, North America </td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">

<td align="left" valign="top">Ronald J. Domanico, Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer </td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>

<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">

<td valign="top" width="1"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top">Dana C. OBrien, Senior Vice President and General Counsel </td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="34"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="19"><font color="#0033a0"></font></td>
<td valign="top" width="1"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top">Raphael J. Shemanski, Senior Vice President and President, Brinks U.S. and Canada </td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="34"> </td>

<td valign="top" width="1"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top">Amit Zukerman, Former Executive Vice President and President, Global Operations and Brinks Global Services (Mr. Zukerman ceased to be an executive officer on June 28, 2019)
</td></tr></tbody></table></div><div style="position:relative;float:left; margin-left:3%; width:49%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Information about named executive officers 2019 salaries can be found under Base Salary on page 33.
Information about annual incentive targets and awards appears under Annual Cash Incentives Awards  BIP beginning on page 34. Information about 2019 LTI targets and awards appears under LongTerm Incentive
Compensation beginning on page 37. Although Mr. Shemanski was not an executive officer in 2018, information about his 2018 compensation is included in the tables in this CD&amp;A to provide context for 2019 compensation amounts. </p>
<p style="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b><i>2019 in Review </i></b></font></p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Brinks reported
strong earnings growth in 2019. Following are key financial performance metrics that are monitored by management and the Board, reported to shareholders, and used in determining compensation amounts for the named executive officers.
</p></div><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt"> </div>
<p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p align="center" style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">
<img alt="LOGO" src="g867884g38g27.jpg"/>
</p> <p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="line-height:8.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;width:16%"> </p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td align="left" valign="top" width="4%">*</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p align="left" style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL; ">These <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font> financial measures are not presented in accordance with U.S.
generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP). See page 34 of the Companys Annual Report on Form <font style="white-space:nowrap">10-K</font> for the year ended December 31, 2019 for a reconciliation of <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font> operating profit and revenue to the most directly comparable GAAP financial measures. </p></td></tr></tbody></table>

<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p></body></html><html><head></head><body><h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<center><div align="left" style="width:8.5in">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>The Brinks Company </b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p><div style="position:relative;float:left; width:48%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b><i>2019 Annual and Long-Term Incentive Payouts </i></b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Incentive program payout determinations for 2019 for the named executive officers reflect the Companys performance against specific,
<font style="white-space:nowrap">pre-established</font> financial goals. The named executive officers received 2019 annual incentive payouts under the Brinks Incentive Plan (BIP) ranging from approximately 77% to 107% of their
respective targets. These payouts reflect adjusted results that were below both the target <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font> operating profit of $415 million and the target <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font> revenue
of $3.8 billion approved by the Compensation Committee, as well as performance against a free cash flow performance goal and performance in the countries within each executives area of responsibility (where applicable) and individual
performance factors. See the description of 2019 annual incentive payouts beginning on page 35. </p> <p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Payouts for Relative TSR PSUs for the 2017  2019 performance
period reflect TSR above the 75th percentile of the peer companies (as a result of stock price appreciation from $41.39 per share at the beginning of the performance period to $93.55 at the end of the performance period), which resulted in payment
of 150% of the target Relative TSR PSUs awarded in 2017. Payouts for Internal Metric PSUs for the 2017  2019 performance period reflect performance above the target and maximum levels of <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font>
operating profit established by the Compensation Committee and resulted in payment to each named executive officer of 200% of the target Internal Metric PSUs awarded in 2017. See pages 40 and 41 for a description of LTI payouts. <b></b> </p>
<p style="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b><i>2019 Compensation for Chief Executive Officer, Douglas A. Pertz </i></b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The primary components of compensation for the Chief Executive Officer consist of base salary, annual incentive and long-term incentive. </p>
<p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">For 2019, the Compensation Committee established an annual incentive target of 135% of Mr. Pertzs base salary. Mr. Pertz received an annual incentive
payout of $1,309,770 in March 2020, which represented approximately 97% of the target in light of Brinks performance against the <font style="white-space:nowrap">pre-established</font> performance goals and Mr. Pertzs individual
</p></div><div style="position:relative;float:left; margin-left:3%; width:49%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">
performance. In February 2019, the Compensation Committee approved an LTI award in the amount of $5,800,000 for Mr. Pertz, which was made up of Internal Metric PSUs, Relative TSR PSUs and
Stock Options. </p> <p style="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b><i>Executive Compensation Program Changes in 2019 </i></b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">In 2019, the Compensation Committee approved several changes to the executive compensation program, which are further described in this CD&amp;A. These changes include:
</p> <p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="34"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="19"><font color="#0033a0"></font></td>
<td valign="top" width="1"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top">Inclusion of a free cash flow metric in the Companys annual incentive plan as a modifier to the payout for <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font> operating profit and revenue performance.
</td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="34"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="19"><font color="#0033a0"></font></td>
<td valign="top" width="1"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top">Transition to time-vested stock options from performance-vesting stock options for all named executive officers. </td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="34"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="19"><font color="#0033a0"></font></td>
<td valign="top" width="1"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top"><font style="white-space:nowrap">Re-balancing</font> of the CEOs annual LTI award type mix to 50% IM PSUs, 25% Relative TSR PSUs and 25% time-vested stock options, maintaining an LTI program comprised entirely of
performance-based equity. </td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b><i>Say on Pay Results and Shareholder Engagement </i></b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">At the 2019 annual meeting, approximately 99% of votes cast on the say on pay proposal approved the compensation awarded to named executive officers. </p>
<p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Compensation Committee and the Board take into account the results of the say on pay vote as they consider the design of the executive compensation
program and policies. There were no changes made to the Companys executive compensation program in direct response to the 2019 say on pay voting results. Members of management and the Board continue to engage in outreach to the
Companys shareholders to discuss governance and compensation policies and practices and emerging issues. </p></div><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt"> </div>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr>
<td></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="1%"></td>
<td width="96%"></td></tr>
<tr style="font-size:1pt">
<td height="2"></td>
<td colspan="2" height="2" style="BORDER-LEFT:1.00pt solid #0033a0"> </td></tr>

<td style="padding-bottom:2pt ;" valign="top"><b>28  </b></td>

</sub>    2020 Proxy Statement</i></td></tr></tbody></table>

<center><div align="left" style="width:8.5in">
<p align="right" style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS </b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:14pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b><a name="toc867884_20"></a>Executive Compensation Program Components for 2019 </b></p>
<p style="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #0033a0"> </p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b><i>Primary Components
</i></b></font></p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Named executive officer compensation awarded in 2019 consisted of the following primary components. </p>
<p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr>
<td width="21%"></td>
<td valign="bottom"></td>
<td width="21%"></td>
<td valign="bottom"></td>
<td width="28%"></td>
<td valign="bottom"></td>
<td width="27%"></td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<td style="padding-bottom:3pt ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000" valign="bottom"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.50em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>Compensation Element</b></p></td>
<td style=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td align="center" style="padding-bottom:3pt ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000" valign="bottom"><b>How Payout Determined</b></td>
<td style=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td align="center" style="padding-bottom:3pt ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000" valign="bottom"><b>Performance Measures</b></td>
<td style=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td align="center" style="padding-bottom:3pt ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000" valign="bottom"><b>Purpose</b></td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<td bgcolor="#0033a0" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="top"> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.50em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#FFFFFF"><b>Salary</b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.50em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#FFFFFF"><b><i> fixed</i></b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; margin-left:0.50em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#FFFFFF"><b><i> paid in cash</i></b></font></p></td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="top">Compensation Committee judgment, informed by evaluation of market data</td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td align="center" bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="top">N/A</td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="top">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Provides compensation at a level consistent with competitive practices</p>
<p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Reflects
role, responsibilities, skills, experience and performance</p> <p style="font-size:3pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt"> </p></td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<td bgcolor="#0033a0" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="top"> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.50em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#FFFFFF"><b>Annual Incentive</b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.50em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#FFFFFF"><b><i> variable</i></b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; margin-left:0.50em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#FFFFFF"><b><i> paid in cash</i></b></font></p></td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="top"> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL">Compensation Committee review of performance against
<font style="white-space:nowrap">pre-established</font> financial goals and individual performance, with discretion to reduce payout amounts</p> <p style="font-size:3pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt"> </p></td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="top"> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font><font style="white-space:nowrap">  Non-GAAP</font> Operating Profit</p> <p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font><font style="white-space:nowrap">  Non-GAAP</font> Revenue</p>
<p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Free Cash
Flow</p></td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="top">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Motivates and rewards executives for achievement of annual goals</p>
<p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Aligns
management and shareholder interests by linking pay and performance</p> <p style="font-size:3pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt"> </p></td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<td bgcolor="#0033a0" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="top"> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.50em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#FFFFFF"><b>Long-Term</b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.50em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#FFFFFF"><b>Incentive: PSUs</b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.50em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#FFFFFF"><b><i> variable</i></b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; margin-left:0.50em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#FFFFFF"><b><i> paid in stock</i></b></font></p></td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="top">Formulaic, with Compensation Committee review of performance against <font style="white-space:nowrap">pre-established</font> goals measured over a three-year performance
period</td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="top"> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font><font style="white-space:nowrap">  3-year</font> <font style="white-space:nowrap">Non-GAAP</font> EBITDA</p> <p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font><font style="white-space:nowrap">  3-year</font> Relative TSR</p>
<p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Stock price
performance</p></td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="top">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Motivates and rewards executives for achievement of long-term goals intended to
increase shareholder value</p> <p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Enhances retention of key executives who drive sustained performance</p>
<p style="font-size:3pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt"> </p></td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<td bgcolor="#0033a0" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="top"> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.50em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#FFFFFF"><b>Long-Term</b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.50em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#FFFFFF"><b>Incentive:</b></font></p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.50em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#FFFFFF"><b>Stock Options</b></font></p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.50em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#FFFFFF"><b><i> variable</i></b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; margin-left:0.50em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#FFFFFF"><b><i> paid in stock</i></b></font></p></td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="top">Options vest at the end of a three-year vesting period and have value only to the extent that the stock price at the time of exercise exceeds the stock price on the grant
date</td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="top">Stock price appreciation</td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="top">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Motivates and rewards executives for achievement of long-term goals intended to
increase shareholder value</p> <p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Enhances retention of key executives who drive sustained performance</p>
<p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Aligns
management and shareholder interests by facilitating management ownership and tying compensation to stock price appreciation over a sustained period</p> <p style="font-size:3pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt"> </p></td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<td bgcolor="#0033a0" valign="top"> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.50em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#FFFFFF"><b>Long-Term</b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.50em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#FFFFFF"><b>Incentive: RSUs</b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.50em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#FFFFFF"><b><i> variable</i></b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; margin-left:0.50em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#FFFFFF"><b><i> paid in stock</i></b></font></p></td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" valign="top">RSUs vest in three, equal annual installments and the value of units depends on stock price at time of vesting</td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" valign="top">Stock price performance</td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" valign="top"> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Motivates and rewards executives for
achievement of long-term goals intended to increase shareholder value</p> <p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Enhances retention of key executives who drive sustained performance</p>
<p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Aligns

<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>The Brinks Company </b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b><i>Secondary Components </i></b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Named executive officers may also receive compensation in the form of one or more of the following components: </p>
<p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" width="100%">

<td style=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td align="center" style="padding-bottom:3pt ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000" valign="bottom"><b>Components of Compensation</b></td>
<td style=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td align="center" style="padding-bottom:3pt ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #000000" valign="bottom"><b>Purpose</b></td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<td bgcolor="#0033a0" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.50em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#FFFFFF"><b>Benefits</b></font></p></td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="top">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Deferred compensation plan participation for U.S. named executive officers</p>
<p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Company
matching contributions on amounts deferred (up to 10% of salary and 10% of any annual incentive payout), the value of which is tied directly to the Companys stock price</p> <p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Defined benefit pension benefits (frozen in the U.S.)</p>
<p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Executive
salary continuation, long-term disability plan, and business accident insurance participation for U.S. named executive officers</p> <p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Welfare plans and other arrangements that are available on a broad basis to U.S.
employees and Switzerland employees, as applicable</p> <p style="font-size:3pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt"> </p></td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="top">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Provides for current and future needs of the executives and their families</p>
<p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Aligns
management and shareholder interests by encouraging management ownership of Company stock through participation in the deferred compensation program</p> <p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Enhances recruitment and retention</p></td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<td bgcolor="#0033a0" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.50em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#FFFFFF"><b>Perquisites</b></font></p></td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="top">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Executive physical examinations</p>
<p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Reimbursement of relocation expenses</p>
<p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Tax
Preparation (available only to Mr. Zukerman)</p> <p style="font-size:3pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt"> </p></td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="top">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Provides for safety and security of executives</p>
<p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Enhances
recruitment and retention</p></td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<td bgcolor="#0033a0" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.50em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#FFFFFF"><b>Severance Pay Plan</b></font></p></td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="top"> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL">Contingent amounts payable only if employment is terminated without cause, other than by
reason of incapacity, or is terminated by the executive with good reason (as defined in the plan)</p> <p style="font-size:3pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt"> </p></td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="top">
<p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Reflects current market practice and enhances retention</p></td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<td bgcolor="#0033a0" valign="top"> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.50em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#FFFFFF"><b>Change in Control</b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; margin-left:0.50em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#FFFFFF"><b>Severance Benefits</b></font></p></td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" valign="top">Contingent amounts payable only if employment is terminated following a change in control</td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" valign="top"> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Encourages the objective evaluation and
execution of potential changes to the Companys strategy and structure</p> <p style="font-size:3pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt"> </p></td></tr>
</tbody></table>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p>

<td style="padding-bottom:2pt ;" valign="top"><i>  <sub style="font-size:85%; vertical-align:bottom">
