</p></body></html><html><head></head><body><h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<center><div align="left" style="width:8.5in">
<p align="right" style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS </b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:14pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b><a name="toc867884_21"></a>Process for Setting Executive Compensation </b></p>
<p style="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #0033a0"> </p>
<p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p><div style="position:relative;float:left; width:48%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b><i>Compensation Committee Review Process.</i></b> The Compensation Committee sets each component of target compensation
for the Companys named executive officers. At least annually, the Compensation Committee undertakes a comprehensive review of competitive market data and information regarding the value of target compensation levels provided to the
Companys Chief Executive Officer and other senior executives, including base salary, target annual incentive and LTI awards.
</p></div><div style="position:relative;float:left; margin-left:3%; width:49%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Compensation Committee reviews the Chief Executive Officers evaluation of the performance of the other named
executive officers, as well as his recommendations related to their compensation, when considering named executive officer target compensation and payout determinations. When the Compensation Committee considers base salary adjustments and sets
annual incentive and LTI targets, it takes the following factors into account: </p></div><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt"> </div>
<p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr>
<td width="34%"></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="1%"></td>
<td width="64%"></td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<td style="padding-bottom:3pt ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" valign="bottom"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.50em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>Compensation Action</b></p></td>
<td style=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td align="center" style="padding-bottom:3pt ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" valign="bottom"><b>Factors Considered in Determining Target Awards</b></td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<td bgcolor="#0033a0" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.40em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#FFFFFF"><b>Base Salary Adjustments</b></font></p></td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="top">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Competitive market information</p>
<p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Retention</p>
<p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Executives performance in his or her role</p>
<p style="font-size:3pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt"> </p></td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<td bgcolor="#0033a0" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.40em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#FFFFFF"><b>Annual Incentive Targets</b></font></p></td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #ffffff" valign="top">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Competitive market information</p>
<p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Criticality of role</p>
<p style="font-size:3pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt"> </p></td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<td bgcolor="#0033a0" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.40em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#FFFFFF"><b>LTI Targets</b></font></p></td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td bgcolor="#e5eaf5" valign="top"> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Competitive market information</p>
<p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Executives potential future contributions to the Company</p>
<p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"></font>  Retention</p>
<p style="font-size:6pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt"> </p></td></tr>
</tbody></table>
<p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p><div style="position:relative;float:left; width:48%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">With respect to the Chief Executive Officer, the Compensation Committee reviews performance relative to annual objectives
and competitive market data in order to make base salary and target annual incentive and LTI determinations and to make recommendations to the Board regarding annual incentive payments. The Compensation Committee is supported in its work by the
Companys Human Resources Department and an independent executive compensation consultant as described below. </p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b><i>Role of Chief Executive Officer.</i></b>
The Chief Executive Officer annually reviews each named executive officers target compensation (other than his own) and recommends changes to elements of a named executive officers target total compensation, as necessary, based on the
factors identified under Process for Setting Executive Compensation above. The Chief Executive Officer makes recommendations regarding payouts for annual incentives in accordance with the terms of the awards. The Compensation Committee
considers the Chief Executive Officers recommendations in making its own determinations regarding compensation awarded to the named executive officers. </p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The
Chief Executive Officer does not play any role in determining his own compensation.
</p></div><div style="position:relative;float:left; margin-left:3%; width:49%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b><i>Role of the Compensation Consultant.</i></b> The Compensation Committee receives data, analysis and support from
Frederic W. Cook &amp; Co., Inc. (FW Cook), which serves as the Compensation Committees and the Corporate Governance Committees independent compensation consultant. </p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">In 2019, FW Cook provided the following services to the Compensation Committee: </p> <p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="34"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="19"><font color="#0033a0"></font></td>
<td valign="top" width="1"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top">Reviewed the materials prepared for the Compensation Committee by management relative to the 2019 compensation program design for the named executive officers; </td></tr></tbody></table>
<p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="34"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="19"><font color="#0033a0"></font></td>
<td valign="top" width="1"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top">Presented market data and analysis for the Compensation Committee to set target compensation for named executive officers; </td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">

<td align="left" valign="top">Reviewed and advised the Compensation Committee on the peer group used for benchmarking 2019 executive compensation levels; and </td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>

<td align="left" valign="top">Reviewed the Companys proxy statement disclosure, including the CD&amp;A and executive compensation tables, and reviewed and advised on proxy advisory firm reports as well as shareholder engagement efforts.
</td></tr></tbody></table></div><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt"> </div>

</sub>    2020 Proxy Statement  </i></td>

<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p></body></html><html><head></head><body><h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<center><div align="left" style="width:8.5in">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>The Brinks Company </b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p><div style="position:relative;float:left; width:48%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b><i>Compensation Consultant Independence.</i></b> In retaining FW Cook, the Compensation Committee considered the six
factors set forth in <font style="white-space:nowrap">Rule 10C-1(b)(4)(i)</font> through (vi) of the Exchange Act. In addition, after review of information provided by each of the members of the Compensation Committee as
</p></div><div style="position:relative;float:left; margin-left:3%; width:49%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">
well as information provided by FW Cook and members of the FW Cook team, the Compensation Committee determined that there are no conflicts of interest raised by the firms work with the
Compensation Committee. </p></div><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt"> </div>
<p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:14pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b><a name="toc867884_22"></a>Factors Considered in
Making Compensation Decisions </b></p> <p style="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #0033a0"> </p>
<p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p><div style="position:relative;float:left; width:48%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">In determining target and actual compensation for the named executive officers in 2019, the Compensation Committee
considered the following key factors. </p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b><i>Performance.</i></b> The executive compensation program provides the named executive officers with opportunities to
receive actual compensation that is greater or less than targeted compensation, depending upon the Companys financial performance and their individual performance. </p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b><i>Market Competitiveness.</i></b> The Compensation Committee generally aims to set named executive officer target compensation levels within a +/-15% range of the
market median. Individual positioning may deviate above or below the median range based on individual circumstances such as criticality of the executives role, individual performance, need to attract externally-recruited executives and
long-term potential to create value for shareholders. The Committee uses two types of market data - survey
</p></div><div style="position:relative;float:left; margin-left:3%; width:49%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">
data and data from a comparison group of companies (the Peer Group) in setting executive compensation levels. Survey data is the primary reference point for all named executive
officers and Peer Group data is used as an additional reference point for the Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer roles and was used for Mr. Zukermans role. </p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Companys peer group is designed to include companies of comparable size, companies with similar business characteristics (including revenue and market
capitalization) and companies with which Brinks competes for talent and investor capital. Below is the list of companies included in the Peer Group for 2019 compensation. During 2019, two companies (Blackhawk Network and DST Systems) were
eliminated from the Peer Group because they were acquired by other organizations and no longer met the criteria for inclusion in Brinks Peer Group.
</p></div><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt"> </div>
<p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr>

<td valign="bottom" width="1%"></td>
<td width="28%"></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="1%"></td>
<td width="28%"></td></tr>

<p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.50em; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>Peer Group Companies for 2019 Compensation</b></font></p></td>
<td style=" BORDER-TOP:1px solid #0033a0; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" valign="bottom">  </td>
<td style="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #0033a0; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #000000" valign="bottom">  </td>

<td style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom">  </td>
<td style="padding-bottom:3pt ;" valign="bottom">Ryder System, Inc.</td></tr>
<tr bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<td style="padding-bottom:3pt ;" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.40em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Blackhawk Network Inc.</p></td>
<td style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom">  </td>
<td style="padding-bottom:3pt ;" valign="bottom">The GEO Group, Inc.</td>
<td style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom">  </td>
<td style="padding-bottom:3pt ;" valign="bottom">Stericycle, Inc.</td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<td style="padding-bottom:3pt ;" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.40em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Celestica, Inc.</p></td>
<td style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom">  </td>
<td style="padding-bottom:3pt ;" valign="bottom">Iron Mountain Incorporated</td>
<td style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom">  </td>
<td style="padding-bottom:3pt ;" valign="bottom">TFI International</td></tr>
<tr bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<td style="padding-bottom:3pt ;" valign="top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.40em; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Cintas Corporation</p></td>
<td style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom">  </td>
<td style="padding-bottom:3pt ;" valign="bottom">Landstar System, Inc.</td>
<td style=" BORDER-LEFT:1px solid #ffffff" valign="bottom">  </td>
<td style="padding-bottom:3pt ;" valign="bottom">United Rentals, Inc.</td></tr>
<tr style="font-size:1px; ">
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #0033a0" valign="top"> </td>
<td style=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #0033a0" valign="bottom">  </td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #0033a0" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td style=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #0033a0" valign="bottom">  </td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #0033a0" valign="bottom"> </td></tr>
</tbody></table>
<p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p><div style="position:relative;float:left; width:48%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Based on the December 2018 market review and resulting 2019 target compensation levels approved by the Committee,
aggregate positioning for the named executive officers during 2019 was within the median range indicated above for base salary and target cash compensation and at the higher end of the median range for target direct compensation. </p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b><i>Mix of Cash and Stock-Based Compensation and Current, Short-Term and Long-Term Awards.</i></b> The Compensation Committee considers the competitive market,
compensation mix and pay
</p></div><div style="position:relative;float:left; margin-left:3%; width:49%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">
for performance philosophy when setting various components of compensation. The Compensation Committee determined that current and short-term compensation (base salary and annual incentives)
should be composed of cash, but that LTI compensation should be composed of stock-based awards that reward the achievement of Company results and increases in Company value over the long-term, and align named executive officers interests with
the economic interests of shareholders. </p></div><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt"> </div>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr>
<td></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="1%"></td>
<td width="96%"></td></tr>
<tr style="font-size:1pt">
<td height="2"></td>
<td colspan="2" height="2" style="BORDER-LEFT:1.00pt solid #0033a0"> </td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<td style="padding-bottom:2pt ;" valign="top"><b>32  </b></td>
<td style=" BORDER-LEFT:1.00pt solid #0033a0" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td style="padding-bottom:2pt ;" valign="top"><i>  <sub style="font-size:85%; vertical-align:bottom">
<img alt="LOGO" src="g867884g23_51.jpg"/>
</sub>    2020 Proxy Statement</i></td></tr></tbody></table>
</div></center>

</p></body></html><html><head></head><body><h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<center><div align="left" style="width:8.5in">
<p align="right" style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS </b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p><div style="position:relative;float:left; width:48%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">In 2019, performance-based compensation (which includes annual incentives, Internal Metric PSUs, Relative TSR PSUs and
Stock Options), excluding any <font style="white-space:nowrap">sign-on</font> equity awards, represented approximately 88% of total target compensation for
</p></div><div style="position:relative;float:left; margin-left:3%; width:49%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">
the Chief Executive Officer and approximately 59% of total target compensation (on average) for the Companys other named executive officers who were serving as of December 31, 2019, as
illustrated below. </p></div><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt"> </div>
<p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="font-size:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p align="center" style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">
<img alt="LOGO" src="g867884g76s72.jpg"/>
</p> <p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:14pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b><a name="toc867884_23"></a>2019 Compensation Decisions by Component </b></p>
<p style="line-height:4.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #0033a0"> </p>
<p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p><div style="position:relative;float:left; width:48%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b><i>Base Salary </i></b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Compensation Committees decisions on base salary levels for the named executive officers are primarily influenced by its review of competitive market
information for comparable positions. These decisions are also influenced by the Companys talent philosophy, which includes differential investment in talent based on the executives performance of his or her duties, criticality of the
executives role to the execution of corporate strategy, and the executives potential to impact future business results. For the named executive officers other than the Chief Executive Officer, the Compensation Committee also considers
the Chief Executive Officers recommended salary adjustments based on position relative to the competitive market information.<b> </b>
</p></div><div style="position:relative;float:left; margin-left:3%; width:49%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">In February 2019, the Compensation Committee approved adjustments to base salaries for each of the named executive
officers, other than Ms. OBrien, who joined the company in April 2019. For each of the officers (other than Ms. OBrien), adjustments were made in connection with the Companys annual merit review process, which reflects
the market-based merit budget as well as performance of each individual executive. Mr. Beechs salary increase also reflects the expansion of his role in 2019 to include responsibility for the companys businesses in Latin America.
Following are the base salaries for each of the named executive officers as of December 31, 2019 (actual salary amounts for 2019 appear in the Summary Compensation Table on page 47):
</p></div><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt"> </div>
<p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>

<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p></body></html><html><head></head><body><h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<center><div align="left" style="width:8.5in">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>The Brinks Company </b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p><div style="position:relative;float:left; width:48%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b><i>Annual Cash Incentive AwardsBIP </i></b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b><i>General </i></b></p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Companys annual cash incentive program for named
executive officers provides incentive compensation that is variable, contingent and directly linked to Company and country or business unit performance. Annual incentive awards are made under the Brinks Incentive Plan (BIP), which
governs annual incentives for executives and other employees. </p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Compensation Committee sets annual incentive performance metrics and goal(s) under the BIP in
February of the performance year. In doing so, the Compensation Committee selects one or more metrics that it believes are aligned with the Companys financial and strategic goals for the year and selects a target level of performance for each
metric that the Compensation Committee believes represents a rigorous goal. </p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Compensation Committee generally considers and approves actual annual incentive
payments for the prior fiscal year in February, based on the Companys performance against the <font style="white-space:nowrap">pre-established</font> BIP performance goals (as modified by <font style="white-space:nowrap">pre-approved</font>
adjustments) and each executives individual performance. The Compensation Committee approves annual incentive payments to all executive
</p></div><div style="position:relative;float:left; margin-left:3%; width:49%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">
officers, with the exception of the Chief Executive Officer. The Board approves any annual incentive payments to the Chief Executive Officer upon the recommendation of the Compensation Committee.
In determining annual incentive payouts, the Compensation Committee and the Board consider Company financial results, the performance of the Chief Executive Officer and the other named executive officers and the recommendations of the Chief
Executive Officer (with respect to the other named executive officers). </p> <p style="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b><i>2019 Annual Incentive Goal Setting </i></b></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Compensation Committee approved three performance metrics for 2019 annual incentives under the BIP: <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font> operating profit
(75% weighting) and <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font> revenue (25% weighting) (in order to ensure focus on improving profitability while at the same time growing the Companys business), and a free cash flow multiplier that could
increase or decrease the Company Performance Factor (described below) by up to 10%. The 2019 <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font> operating profit, revenue and free cash flow goals are set forth below. The Compensation Committee believes
that these goals represent rigorous objectives for our named executive officers and align with shareholder interests. </p></div><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt"> </div>
<p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="font-size:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p align="center" style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">
<img alt="LOGO" src="g867884g13s53.jpg"/>
</p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr>
<td></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="1%"></td>
<td width="96%"></td></tr>
<tr style="font-size:1pt">
<td height="2"></td>
<td colspan="2" height="2" style="BORDER-LEFT:1.00pt solid #0033a0"> </td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<td style="padding-bottom:2pt ;" valign="top"><b>34  </b></td>
<td style=" BORDER-LEFT:1.00pt solid #0033a0" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td style="padding-bottom:2pt ;" valign="top"><i>  <sub style="font-size:85%; vertical-align:bottom">
<img alt="LOGO" src="g867884g23_51.jpg"/>
</sub>    2020 Proxy Statement</i></td></tr></tbody></table>
</div></center>
<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p></body></html><html><head></head><body><h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<center><div align="left" style="width:8.5in">
<p align="right" style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS </b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p><div style="position:relative;float:left; width:48%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Each year, in connection with the approval of the annual incentive performance goals, the Compensation Committee also
approves specific adjustments that the Compensation Committee may make at the end of the year to the performance results against the goal. In 2019, the Compensation Committee determined that, when considering performance against the 2019 <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font> operating profit and revenue performance goals, it would exclude the positive or negative impact of acquisitions and divestitures, the positive or negative impact of foreign exchange translation versus the
foreign exchange rates used in the 2019 business plan, except for highly inflationary countries, where 50% of such foreign exchange translation would be excluded, and the impact of unusual or infrequently occurring events, initiatives or
transactions. </p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Compensation Committee applies straight-line interpolation for determining award payouts when performance results fall between the goals above.
For example, achievement of $413.6 million in <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font> operating profit would equate to a payout factor of 98% for that performance metric.
</p></div><div style="position:relative;float:left; margin-left:3%; width:49%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b><i>2019 Annual Incentive Target Award Opportunities </i></b></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">In February 2019, the Compensation Committee established 2019 annual incentive targets for the named executive officers. The annual incentive target is expressed as a
percentage of annual base salary and is designed to be indicative of the incentive payment that each named executive officer would expect to receive on the basis of strong performance by the Company against the performance goals for the BIP. Annual
incentive targets for 2019 were approved for each of the named executive officers by the Compensation Committee as set forth below. The Committee approved an increase in the annual incentive targets for Messrs. Pertz and, Domanico to better align
their compensation with the market data for their respective roles and, for Mr. Beech, to reflect the expansion of his role. The terms of the BIP prohibit incentive payments that exceed 200% of a named executive officers annual incentive
target unless approved by the Compensation Committee in recognition of extraordinary contributions related to strategic initiatives or transactions.
</p></div><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt"> </div>
<p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td align="left" valign="top" width="4%">(1)</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p align="left" style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL; ">Ms. OBriens 2019 target reflects the <font style="white-space:nowrap">pro-ration</font> of her award
because she joined the Company in April 2019. </p></td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b><i>2019 Annual Incentive Payouts </i></b></p>
<p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p><div style="position:relative;float:left; width:48%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">In February 2020, the Compensation Committee (and the independent members of the Board for Mr. Pertz) approved 2019
annual incentive payouts for the named executive officers. To determine the actual annual incentive payments for the named executive officers, the Compensation Committee (and the independent members of the Board) considered the Companys <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font> operating profit, <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font> revenue, and free cash flow results against the <font style="white-space:nowrap">pre-established</font> goals set by the Compensation
Committee (Company Performance) as well as each executives individual performance (Individual
</p></div><div style="position:relative;float:left; margin-left:3%; width:49%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">
Performance). For Messrs. Beech and Shemanski, the Compensation Committee also considered the performance of the operating companies within each executives scope of responsibility,
which is referred to as Combined Operating Performance or U.S. Operating Performance, as applicable. Mr. Zukerman received an award based on Company Performance and Individual Performance (deemed to be 100%) per the terms of his Consulting
Agreement. The award was <font style="white-space:nowrap">pro-rated</font> for the period of January 1, 2019 through June 30, 2019, so was reduced by 50%.
</p></div><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt"> </div>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p>

</sub>    2020 Proxy Statement  </i></td>

</p></body></html><html><head></head><body><h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<center><div align="left" style="width:8.5in">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>The Brinks Company </b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b><i>Annual Incentive Payout Calculation for Messrs. Pertz and Domanico and
Ms. OBrien </i></b></font></p> <p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="font-size:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p align="center" style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">
<img alt="LOGO" src="g867884g80y90.jpg"/>
</p> <p style="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b><i>Annual Incentive Payout Calculation for Mr. Beech </i></b></font></p>
<p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="font-size:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p align="center" style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">
<img alt="LOGO" src="g867884g00j24.jpg"/>
</p> <p style="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b><i>Annual Incentive Payout Calculation for Mr. Shemanski </i></b></font></p>
<p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="font-size:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p align="center" style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">
<img alt="LOGO" src="g867884g76w66.jpg"/>
</p>
<p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p><div style="position:relative;float:left; width:48%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Company Performance Factor was determined by the Compensation Committee to be 88%, which reflects the Companys
adjusted <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font> operating profit results of $413.6 million versus the 2019 performance goal of $415 million, the adjusted <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font> revenue results of
$3.696 billion versus the performance goal of $3.8 billion and adjusted free cash flow results of $306 million versus the free cash flow modifier range of $290 to $330 million. In approving the results used to determine annual incentive
funding and the Company Performance Factor, the Compensation Committee considered the Companys reported 2019 <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font> operating profit results of $391.6 million and
<font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font> revenue results of $3.68 billion, which were then adjusted upward to remove the impact of certain foreign exchange translation, certain acquisition-related expenses and certain expenses related
to legal fees and settlements. The results were adjusted downward to remove the impact of acquisitions completed during the year. <font style="white-space:nowrap">Non-GAAP</font> operating profit and <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font>
revenue are reconciled to the most directly comparable GAAP measures on page 34 of the Companys 2019 Annual Report on Form <font style="white-space:nowrap">10-K.</font> With respect to the free cash flow multiplier, the Compensation Committee
considered reported results (excluding cash taxes and capital expenses for cash devices) of $218 million, which were adjusted upward to remove the impact of certain foreign exchange translation, certain acquisition-related expenses, certain
expenses related to legal fees and settlements, and the impact of an internal loss, and to include the impact of a sale of certain tax receivables to a third party. The free cash flow results
</p></div><div style="position:relative;float:left; margin-left:3%; width:49%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">
were adjusted downward to remove the impact of acquisitions completed during the year. This resulted in adjusted free cash flow of $306 million, representing a free cash flow modifier of 98%.
</p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">In addition to the solid, but below target, Company performance that resulted in a Company Performance Factor of 88%, the Compensation Committee also considered
Mr. Pertzs recommendations regarding individual performance of each of the named executive officers (other than Mr. Zukerman, for whom individual performance was deemed 100% pursuant to the terms of his Consulting Agreement, as
described on page 65). </p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">For Mr. Domanico, the Committee approved an annual incentive at approximately 88% of target and considered Mr. Domanicos
overall leadership of the Companys financial operations with extensive efforts to achieve improved free cash flow, his effective leadership of the France business, with operating profit up 12% from improved operations, pricing and acquisition
synergies, as well as his support in pursuing acquisitions, including the acquisition of the majority of the cash operations of G4S plc. </p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">For Mr. Beech, the
Committee approved an annual incentive at approximately 107% of target and considered the strong financial results in the Latin America region, particularly the very strong results in Mexico, as well as strong organic revenue growth in Brazil and
Argentina, driving full South America segment margin to 24%, as well as Mr. Beechs effective leadership of the Companys global security organization.
</p></div><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt"> </div>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">

<td valign="bottom" width="1%"></td>

<td style="padding-bottom:2pt ;" valign="top"><b>36  </b></td>
<td style=" BORDER-LEFT:1.00pt solid #0033a0" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td style="padding-bottom:2pt ;" valign="top"><i>  <sub style="font-size:85%; vertical-align:bottom">
<img alt="LOGO" src="g867884g23_51.jpg"/>
</sub>    2020 Proxy Statement</i></td></tr></tbody></table>
</div></center>
<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p></body></html><html><head></head><body><h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<center><div align="left" style="width:8.5in">
<p align="right" style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS </b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p><div style="position:relative;float:left; width:48%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">For Ms. OBrien, the Committee approved an annual incentive at approximately 88% of target, taking into
consideration her efforts to improve the structure and effectiveness of the Companys legal and compliance organization, including the settlement of certain outstanding litigation, as well as her support of strategic transactions including the
negotiation of the planned G4S acquisition. </p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">For Mr. Shemanski, the Committee approved an annual incentive at approximately 77%, taking into consideration Mr.
Shemanskis effective leadership of the U.S. and Canada businesses, including ongoing integration of the Dunbar operations in the U.S. business and overseeing changes in the Canada leadership team to improve the trajectory of that business.
</p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Mr. Pertzs annual incentive award was approved by the Board at 97% of target, reflecting the Companys
</p></div><div style="position:relative;float:left; margin-left:3%; width:49%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">
overall operating performance, including reported year over year non-GAAP revenue growth of 7% and a non-GAAP operating profit increase of 13%, with an improvement of 50 basis points in the
Companys non-GAAP operating profit margin rate. The award also reflected Mr. Pertzs individual achievements in 2019, particularly with respect to the successful completion of the Companys three-year strategic plan, exceeding the
three-year operating profit target, the development of a new three-year strategic plan, as well as the continued identification and execution of accretive acquisitions including the planned G4S acquisition. </p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The following table sets forth the actual annual incentive payments for 2019. Annual incentive payments are also shown in the Summary Compensation Table on page 47.
</p></div><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt"> </div>
<p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>

<td nowrap="" style="padding-bottom:3pt ;" valign="bottom"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; line-height:14pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">% </p></td></tr>

<td style="padding-bottom:3pt ;" valign="top">

<td valign="bottom">  </td>
<td style="padding-bottom:3pt ;" valign="bottom"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; line-height:14pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"> </p></td>
<td style="padding-bottom:3pt ;" valign="bottom"> <p align="right" style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; line-height:14pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">248,063</p></td>
<td nowrap="" style="padding-bottom:3pt ;" valign="bottom"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; line-height:14pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"> </p></td>

<td nowrap="" style="padding-bottom:3pt ;" valign="bottom"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; line-height:14pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"> </p></td>

<td align="left" valign="top"> <p align="left" style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL; ">Ms. OBriens annual incentive payout was <font style="white-space:nowrap">pro-rated</font> as she joined
the Company in April 2019. </p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td align="left" valign="top" width="4%">(2)</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p align="left" style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL; ">Mr. Zukermans 2019 annual incentive payout was made pursuant to the terms of a Consulting Agreement with the
Company, disclosed on a Current Report on Form <font style="white-space:nowrap">8-K</font> filed with the SEC on May 8, 2019 and described on page 65. </p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p style="font-size:18pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p><div style="position:relative;float:left; width:48%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b><i>Long-Term Incentive Compensation </i></b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b><i>General </i></b></p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Company provides LTI compensation to ensure that a
significant portion of named executive officer compensation is tied to the Companys long-term results and increases in shareholder value. In 2019, the Compensation Committee approved LTI awards to named executive officers that included
Internal Metric PSUs, Relative TSR PSUs, and Stock Options and, for all executives other than the Chief Executive Officer, RSUs. </p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><u>Internal Metric PSUs</u>. The
performance period for the Internal Metric PSUs is generally three years,
</p></div><div style="position:relative;float:left; margin-left:3%; width:49%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">
beginning on January 1 of the first year of the performance period and ending on December 31 of the third year of the performance period. Named executive officers benefit from Internal
Metric PSUs only to the extent Brinks achieves performance goals determined by the Compensation Committee at the beginning of the performance period. After the conclusion of the performance period, Internal Metric PSU payouts will be in shares
of Brinks Common Stock and will range from 0 to 200% of the target award. The number of shares ultimately paid will depend on performance against the goals established by the Compensation Committee.
</p></div><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt"> </div>
<p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p align="center" style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">
<img alt="LOGO" src="g867884g00b81.jpg"/>
</p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr>
<td width="96%"></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="1%"></td>
<td></td>
<td></td>
<td></td></tr>
<tr style="font-size:1pt">
<td height="2" style="BORDER-RIGHT:1.00pt solid #0033a0; padding-left:8pt"> </td>
<td colspan="4" height="2"></td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<td align="right" style="padding-bottom:2pt ;BORDER-RIGHT:1.00pt solid #0033a0; padding-left:8pt" valign="top"><i><sub style="font-size:85%; vertical-align:bottom">
<img alt="LOGO" src="g867884g23_51.jpg"/>
</sub>    2020 Proxy Statement  </i></td>
<td valign="bottom"> </td>
<td style="padding-bottom:2pt ;" valign="bottom"><b> </b></td>
<td align="right" style="padding-bottom:2pt ;" valign="bottom"><b>  37</b></td>
<td nowrap="" style="padding-bottom:2pt ;" valign="bottom"><b> </b></td></tr></tbody></table>
</div></center>
<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p></body></html><html><head></head><body><h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<center><div align="left" style="width:8.5in">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>The Brinks Company </b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p><div style="position:relative;float:left; width:48%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><u>Relative TSR PSUs</u>. The performance period for the Relative TSR PSUs is generally three years, beginning on
January 1 of the first year of the performance period and ending on December 31 of the third year of the performance period. Named executive officers benefit from Relative TSR PSUs only to the extent Brinks achieves performance goals
determined by the Compensation Committee at the beginning of the
</p></div><div style="position:relative;float:left; margin-left:3%; width:49%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">
performance period. After the conclusion of the performance period, Relative TSR PSU payouts will be in shares of Brinks Common Stock and will range from 0 to 200% of the target award. The
number of shares ultimately paid will depend on performance against the goals established by the Compensation Committee. </p></div><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt"> </div>
<p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="font-size:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p align="center" style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">
<img alt="LOGO" src="g867884g00b81.jpg"/>
</p>
<p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p><div style="position:relative;float:left; width:48%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><u>RSUs</u>. Each RSU is the economic equivalent of one share of Brinks Common Stock and is settled in shares of
Brinks Common Stock. RSUs retain value even if the price of Brinks Common Stock decreases below the price on the date of grant as long as the named executive officer satisfies the vesting requirements. </p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><u>Stock Options</u>. Each Stock Option represents an opportunity to purchase a share of the Companys common stock at the fair market value as of the grant date,
subject to time-based and/or performance-based vesting conditions. </p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b><i>2019 Long-Term Incentive Target Award Opportunities </i></b></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Compensation Committee approved annual LTI awards in February 2019. For each of the named executive officers other than the Chief Executive Officer, 2019 LTI awards
included equity awards under the 2017 Equity Incentive Plan composed of Internal Metric PSUs (25% of the award), Relative TSR PSUs (25% of the award), RSUs (25% of the award), and Stock Options (25% of the award). For Mr. Pertz, the Committee
approved a 2019 LTI award that included Internal Metric PSUs (50% of the award), Relative TSR PSUs (25% of the award) and Stock Options (25% of the award). In establishing LTI compensation targets for each named executive officer for 2019, the
Compensation Committee
</p></div><div style="position:relative;float:left; margin-left:3%; width:49%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">
considered competitive market information, in the context of the overall LTI compensation philosophy, which takes into account the executives skills and experience, individual performance,
and potential future contributions to the Company. The Compensation Committee approves LTI awards based on a target dollar value that is then converted into a number of Relative TSR PSUs, Internal Metric PSUs, RSUs, and Stock Options, based on the
grant date fair value of each award type. The Committee believes this approach is aligned with the market-based LTI grant value determination for each position. </p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">In
2019, the Compensation Committee approved an annual LTI award for Mr. Pertz in an amount that was less than the prior years award, maintaining the reliance on performance-based awards, but reducing the level of risk by replacing
performance stock options with time-vested stock options. The Committee also adjusted the mix of equity vehicles in Mr. Pertzs LTI award to again include Internal Metric PSUs in light of managements continued focus on EBITDA growth.
</p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The following table sets forth the aggregate amount of LTI award opportunities approved by the Compensation Committee for 2019, for each of the named executive
officers. The equity awards appear in the Grants of Plan-Based Awards Table on page 50. </p></div><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt"> </div>
<p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>

<td style=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #0033a0" valign="bottom">  </td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #0033a0" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #0033a0" valign="bottom"> </td>

<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #0033a0" valign="bottom"> </td></tr>
</tbody></table>

<td style="padding-bottom:2pt ;" valign="top"><b>38  </b></td>
<td style=" BORDER-LEFT:1.00pt solid #0033a0" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td style="padding-bottom:2pt ;" valign="top"><i>  <sub style="font-size:85%; vertical-align:bottom">

</sub>    2020 Proxy Statement</i></td></tr></tbody></table>

<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p></body></html><html><head></head><body><h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<center><div align="left" style="width:8.5in">
<p align="right" style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS </b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p> <p style="line-height:8.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;width:16%"> </p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td align="left" valign="top" width="4%">(1)</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p align="left" style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL; ">The value of equity awards included in total LTI compensation is calculated using assumptions for financial reporting
purposes; therefore the target amounts in the table above differ from the amount reported in the Summary Compensation and Grants of Plan Based Awards Tables. See Note 18 to the Companys financial statements in its Annual Report on Form <font style="white-space:nowrap">10-K</font> for the year ended December 31, 2019. See also footnotes 3 and 4 to the Summary Compensation Table on page 47. </p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td align="left" valign="top" width="4%">(2)</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p align="left" style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL; ">Mr. Zukermans 2019 long-term incentive award was forfeited pursuant to the terms of a Consulting Agreement with
the Company, disclosed on a Current Report on Form <font style="white-space:nowrap">8-K</font> filed with the SEC on May 8, 2019. </p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p><div style="position:relative;float:left; width:48%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b><i>Equity Awards under the 2017 Equity Incentive Plan </i></b></p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><u>Internal Metric PSU Awards</u>. In 2019, Internal Metric PSUs represented 25% of the LTI award for each named executive officer other than the Chief Executive
Officer, whose Internal Metric PSUs represented 50% of his award. In February 2019, the Compensation Committee established three year <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font> EBITDA as the performance metric for the Internal Metric PSUs
awarded in 2019 to incentivize leaders to execute our organic and acquisition growth strategy, align to one of the most common performance metrics used for LTI plans in our peer group and ensure that we did not have overlap with the metrics in our
annual incentive plan. </p></div><div style="position:relative;float:left; margin-left:3%; width:49%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Internal Metric PSUs awarded in 2019 are subject to a three-year performance period that began on January 1, 2019
and will end on December 31, 2021. </p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Compensation Committee established threshold, target and maximum levels of
<font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font> EBITDA for the Internal Metric PSUs, which correspond to payouts in shares of Brinks Common Stock at a rate of 50%, 100% and 200% of target as noted below. </p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">At the time the Compensation Committee established the target levels of performance, it believed that achievement of the threshold performance level was attainable, but
not certain, that target performance would be difficult to achieve, and that the maximum level of performance was possible, but not likely to be achieved.
</p></div><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt"> </div>
<p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr>
<td width="51%"></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="1%"></td>
<td width="48%"></td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt">
<td align="center" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #0033a0" valign="bottom"> <p align="center" style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b><font style="white-space:nowrap">3-Year</font>
Cumulative</b></font></p> <p align="center" style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b><font style="white-space:nowrap">Non-GAAP</font> EBITDA</b></font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>Performance Levels</b></font></p></td>
<td style=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #0033a0" valign="bottom">  </td>
<td align="center" style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1.00pt solid #0033a0" valign="bottom"> <p align="center" style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>Performance Share Units Earned</b></font></p>
<p align="center" style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:1pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>as a Percent of Target</b></font></p></td></tr>
<tr bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style="font-size:1pt">
<td height="4"></td>
<td colspan="2" height="4"></td></tr>
<tr bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<td align="center" style="padding-bottom:3pt ;" valign="top"> <p align="center" style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.40em; line-height:14pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Below Threshold Performance</p></td>
<td valign="bottom">  </td>
<td align="center" style="padding-bottom:3pt ;" valign="bottom"> <p align="center" style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; line-height:14pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">0%</p></td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<td align="center" style="padding-bottom:3pt ;" valign="top"> <p align="center" style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.40em; line-height:14pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Threshold Performance</p></td>
<td valign="bottom">  </td>
<td align="center" style="padding-bottom:3pt ;" valign="bottom"> <p align="center" style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; line-height:14pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">50%</p></td></tr>
<tr bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<td align="center" style="padding-bottom:3pt ;" valign="top"> <p align="center" style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.40em; line-height:14pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Target Performance</p></td>
<td valign="bottom">  </td>
<td align="center" style="padding-bottom:3pt ;" valign="bottom"> <p align="center" style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; line-height:14pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">100%</p></td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<td align="center" style="padding-bottom:3pt ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #0033a0" valign="top"> <p align="center" style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.40em; line-height:14pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Maximum
Performance</p></td>
<td style=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #0033a0" valign="bottom">  </td>
<td align="center" style="padding-bottom:3pt ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #0033a0" valign="bottom"> <p align="center" style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; line-height:14pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">200%</p></td></tr>
</tbody></table>
<p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p><div style="position:relative;float:left; width:48%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><u>Relative TSR PSU Awards</u>. In 2019, Relative TSR PSUs represented 25% of the LTI award for each named executive
officer. In February 2019, the Compensation Committee established that the Companys Relative TSR will be determined by the percentile rank of the Companys TSR for the performance period as compared to the TSR for the performance period
for companies in the S&amp;P Mid Cap 400 with foreign revenues that exceed 50% of </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">total revenues. The Relative TSR PSUs awarded in
</p></div><div style="position:relative;float:left; margin-left:3%; width:49%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">
2019 are subject to a three-year performance period that began on January 1, 2019 and will end on December 31, 2021. </p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Compensation Committee established threshold, target and maximum levels of TSR performance, which correspond to payouts in shares of Brinks Common Stock at a
rate of 25%, 100% and 200% of target as noted below. </p></div><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt"> </div>
<p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>

<td valign="bottom">  </td>

<td align="center" style="padding-bottom:3pt ;" valign="top"> <p align="center" style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.40em; line-height:14pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Median</p></td>
<td valign="bottom">  </td>
<td align="center" style="padding-bottom:3pt ;" valign="bottom"> <p align="center" style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; line-height:14pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">100%</p></td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<td align="center" style="padding-bottom:3pt ;" valign="top"> <p align="center" style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.40em; line-height:14pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">75th Percentile</p></td>
<td valign="bottom">  </td>
<td align="center" style="padding-bottom:3pt ;" valign="bottom"> <p align="center" style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; line-height:14pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">150%</p></td></tr>
<tr bgcolor="#e5eaf5" style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<td align="center" style="padding-bottom:3pt ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #0033a0" valign="top"> <p align="center" style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.40em; line-height:14pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">90th
Percentile</p></td>
<td style=" BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #0033a0" valign="bottom">  </td>
<td align="center" style="padding-bottom:3pt ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #0033a0" valign="bottom"> <p align="center" style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; line-height:14pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">200%</p></td></tr>
</tbody></table>
<p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p><div style="position:relative;float:left; width:48%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">At the time the Compensation Committee established the target levels of performance, it believed that achievement of the
threshold performance level was attainable, but not certain, that target performance
</p></div><div style="position:relative;float:left; margin-left:3%; width:49%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">
would be difficult to achieve, and that the maximum level of performance was possible, but not likely to be achieved.
</p></div><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt"> </div>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">

<tr style="font-size:1pt">

<td colspan="4" height="2"></td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<td align="right" style="padding-bottom:2pt ;BORDER-RIGHT:1.00pt solid #0033a0; padding-left:8pt" valign="top"><i><sub style="font-size:85%; vertical-align:bottom">
<img alt="LOGO" src="g867884g23_51.jpg"/>
</sub>    2020 Proxy Statement  </i></td>

<td align="right" style="padding-bottom:2pt ;" valign="bottom"><b>  39</b></td>

</div></center>
<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p></body></html><html><head></head><body><h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<center><div align="left" style="width:8.5in">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>The Brinks Company </b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p><div style="position:relative;float:left; width:48%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><u>RSU Awards</u>. In 2019, RSUs represented 25% of the LTI award for each named executive officer other than the Chief
Executive Officer, who did not receive any RSUs. RSUs awarded as part of the named executive officers 2019 long-term incentive awards will vest in three equal annual installments beginning on the first anniversary of the grant date. </p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><u>Stock Options</u>. In 2019, Stock Options represented 25% of each named executive officers LTI award. The Stock Options will vest on the third anniversary of
the grant date. In February 2019, the Compensation Committee made a change in the type of stock options awarded to named executive officers, determining to award stock options without a stock price performance condition to better align the
Companys LTI award practices with market practice and to be better balance incentive and retention value for the Companys executives. </p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b><i>2019 PSU
Payouts </i></b></p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">In 2020, the Compensation Committee certified the level of payouts for the Relative TSR PSUs and Internal Metric PSUs that were awarded in 2017. The
long-term incentive awards to the named executive officers other than the Chief Executive Officer were comprised of Relative TSR PSUs (25%), Internal Metric PSUs (25%) RSUs (25%) and Performance Stock Options (25%). The Relative TSR PSU payouts were
determined by Brinks total shareholder return (calculated based on the 20 day average closing stock prices prior to and at the end of the three-year performance period) as compared to companies in the S&amp;P Small Cap 600 with foreign
revenues exceeding 50%. The Compensation Committee approved a payout of Relative TSR PSUs at a level of
</p></div><div style="position:relative;float:left; margin-left:3%; width:49%;padding-right:0%;padding-bottom:8pt;overflow:hidden;padding-top:3pt">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">
150% of target, which reflected TSR at the 89th percentile as compared to the peer companies (as a result of stock price appreciation from $41.39 per share at the beginning of the performance
period compared to $93.55 per share at the end of the performance period). Individual payouts to each of the named executive officers appear in the Realized Pay Table on page 49. </p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The Internal Metric PSU payouts for the 2017  2019 performance period were determined by the Companys performance against threshold, target and maximum
levels of <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font> operating profit for the performance period beginning January 1, 2017 and December 31, 2019. In February 2019, the Compensation Committee certified Company performance against the
goals. The performance exceeded both the target performance range of $902  942 million and the maximum performance level of $977 million of <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font> operating profit, which resulted
in a payout of 200% of target shares. </p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The cumulative <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font> operating profit performance result of $1,100 million reflects
adjustments (in accordance with the terms of the 2013 Equity Incentive Plan) for the impact of foreign exchange, acquisitions and divestitures, changes in pension accounting and exclusion of amortization expenses. These adjustments were designed to
ensure that participants are neither helped nor hurt by changes in foreign exchange rates, changes in how we measure <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font> results or the impact or timing of acquisitions or divestitures. </p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">The following tables show the Companys performance against the PSU performance goals, resulting in the payouts described above.<b> </b>
</p></div><div style="clear:both; height:0pt; font-size:0pt"> </div>
<p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p align="center" style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">
<img alt="LOGO" src="g867884g70u75.jpg"/>
</p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p>
<table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr>
<td></td>
<td valign="bottom" width="1%"></td>
<td width="96%"></td></tr>
<tr style="font-size:1pt">
<td height="2"></td>
<td colspan="2" height="2" style="BORDER-LEFT:1.00pt solid #0033a0"> </td></tr>
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid ; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">
<td style="padding-bottom:2pt ;" valign="top"><b>40  </b></td>
<td style=" BORDER-LEFT:1.00pt solid #0033a0" valign="bottom"> </td>
<td style="padding-bottom:2pt ;" valign="top"><i>  <sub style="font-size:85%; vertical-align:bottom">
<img alt="LOGO" src="g867884g23_51.jpg"/>
</sub>    2020 Proxy Statement</i></td></tr></tbody></table>
</div></center>
