<td style="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #0033a0" valign="bottom"> </td></tr>
</tbody></table> <p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p> <p style="line-height:8.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000;width:16%"> </p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td align="left" valign="top" width="4%">(a)</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p align="left" style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL; ">See Other Items Not Allocated To Segments below for details. We do not consider these items to be reflective
of our core operating performance due to the variability of such items from period-to-period in terms of size, nature and significance. </p></td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="font-size:2pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:8pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td align="left" valign="top" width="4%">(b)</td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p align="left" style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:8pt; font-family:ARIAL; ">To adjust for the change in the balance of customer obligations related to cash received and processed in certain of our
secure Cash Management Services operations. The title to this cash transfers to us for a short period of time. The cash is generally credited to customers accounts the following day and we do not consider it as available for general corporate
purposes in the management of our liquidity and capital resources. </p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p>

<td align="right" style="padding-bottom:2pt ;" valign="bottom"><b>  A-1</b></td>
<td nowrap="" style="padding-bottom:2pt ;" valign="bottom"><b> </b></td></tr></tbody></table>

<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
</p></body></html><html><head></head><body><h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<center><div align="left" style="width:8.5in">
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>The Brinks Company </b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:14pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>Other Items Not Allocated To Segments (Unaudited) </b></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>The Brinks Company and subsidiaries </b></p> <p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Brinks measures its segment
results before income and expenses for corporate activities and for certain other items. See below for a summary of the other items not allocated to segments. </p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>Venezuela operations</b> Prior to the deconsolidation of our Venezuelan subsidiaries effective June 30, 2018, we excluded from our segment results all of
our Venezuela operating results, due to the Venezuelan governments restrictions that have prevented us from repatriating funds. As a result, the Chief Executive Officer, the Companys Chief Operating Decision maker
(CODM), has assessed segment performance and has made resource decisions by segment excluding Venezuela operating results. </p> <p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>Reorganization and
Restructuring </b></p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><i>2016 Restructuring </i></p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">In the fourth quarter of 2016,
management implemented restructuring actions across our global business operations and our corporate functions. As a result of these actions, we recognized charges of $18.1 million in 2016, an additional $17.3 million in 2017 and
$13.0 million in 2018. The actions under this program were substantially completed in 2018, with cumulative pretax charges of approximately $48 million. </p>
<p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><i>Other Restructurings </i></p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Management periodically implements restructuring actions
in targeted sections of our business. As a result of these actions, we recognized charges of $4.6 million in 2017, $7.6 million in 2018 and $28.8 million in 2019, primarily severance costs. For the current restructuring actions, we
expect to incur additional costs between $1 million and $3 million in future periods. </p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL">Due to the unique circumstances around these charges, these
management-directed items have not been allocated to segment results and are excluded from <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font> results. </p>
<p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>Acquisitions and dispositions</b><b></b> Certain acquisition and disposition items that are not considered part of the ongoing activities of the business and
are special in nature are consistently excluded from <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font> results. These items are described below: </p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><i>2019 Acquisitions
and Dispositions </i></p> <p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">

<td width="5%"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%"><font color="#0033a0"></font></td>
<td valign="top" width="1%"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p align="left" style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">We incurred $43.1 million in integration costs related to Dunbar, Rodoban, COMEF and TVS in 2019.
</p></td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">

<center><div align="left" style="width:8.5in">
<p align="right" style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:11pt; font-family:ARIAL"><font color="#0033a0"><b>APPENDIX A </b></font></p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="5%"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%"><font color="#0033a0"></font></td>
<td valign="top" width="1%"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p align="left" style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">Compensation expense related to the retention of key Dunbar employees was $4.1 million in 2018. </p></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p style="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt"> </p>
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt" width="100%">
<tbody><tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td width="5%"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top" width="3%"><font color="#0033a0"></font></td>
<td valign="top" width="1%"> </td>
<td align="left" valign="top"> <p align="left" style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:ARIAL; font-size:10pt">We recognized a net gain in 2018 ($2.6 million, net of statutory employee benefit) on the sale of real estate in
Mexico. </p></td></tr></tbody></table> <p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>Argentina highly inflationary impact</b> Beginning in the third quarter of 2018, we designated Argentinas economy as highly
inflationary for accounting purposes. As a result, Argentine peso-denominated monetary assets and liabilities are now remeasured at each balance sheet date to the currency exchange rate then in effect, with currency remeasurement gains and losses
recognized in earnings. In addition, nonmonetary assets retain a higher historical basis when the currency is devalued. The higher historical basis results in incremental expense being recognized when the nonmonetary assets are consumed. In the
second half of 2018, we recognized $8.0 million in pretax charges related to highly inflationary accounting, including currency remeasurement losses of $6.2 million. In 2019, we recognized $14.5 million in pretax charges related to
highly inflationary accounting, including currency remeasurement losses of $11.3 million. These amounts are excluded from <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font> results. </p>
<p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>Internal loss </b>A former <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-management</font> employee in our U.S. global services operations embezzled funds from Brinks
in prior years. Except for a small deductible amount, the amount of the internal loss related to the embezzlement was covered by our insurance. In an effort to cover up the embezzlement, the former employee intentionally misstated the underlying
accounts receivable subledger data. In 2019, we incurred $4.5 million in costs (primarily third party expenses) to reconstruct the accounts receivables subledger. In the third quarter of 2019, we were able to identify $4.0 million of
revenues billed and collected in prior periods which had never been recorded in the general ledger. We also identified and recorded $0.3 million in bank fees, which had been incurred in prior periods. The rebuild of the subledger was completed
during the third quarter of 2019. Based on the reconstructed subledger, we were able to analyze and quantify the uncollected receivables from prior periods. Although we plan to attempt to collect these receivables, we estimated an increase to bad
debt expense of $13.7 million in the third quarter of 2019. The estimate of the allowance for doubtful accounts was adjusted in the fourth quarter of 2019 for an additional $6.4 million and will be adjusted in future periods, if needed, as
assumptions related to the collectability of these accounts receivable change. Out of the total $20.1 million in bad debt expense recorded in the second half of 2019, $19.2 million represented an allowance on $34.0 million of
accounts receivable or 56%. Due to the unusual nature of this internal loss and the related errors in the subledger data, along with the fact that management has excluded these amounts when evaluating internal performance, we have excluded these net
charges from segment and <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font> results. </p> <p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:ARIAL"><b>Reporting compliance</b> Certain compliance costs (primarily third party
expenses) are excluded from <font style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</font> results. These costs relate to the implementation and January 1, 2019 adoption of the new lease accounting standard ($2.7 million in 2018 and $1.8 million in
2019) and the mitigation of material weaknesses ($1.8 million in 2018 and $0.3 million in 2019). </p>
<p style="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt"> </p>

<img alt="LOGO" src="g867884pxi14946.jpg"/>
</p> <p style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:0.5pt"><font color="#FFFFFF">THE </font><br/><font color="#FFFFFF" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:0.5pt">ANNUAL </font><br/><font color="#FFFFFF" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:0.5pt">BRINKS </font><br/><font color="#FFFFFF" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:0.5pt">MEETING OF SHAREHOLDERS </font><br/><font color="#FFFFFF" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:0.5pt">COMPANY </font><br/><font color="#FFFFFF" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:0.5pt">OF May 8, 2020 PROXY VOTING INSTRUCTIONS </font><br/><font color="#FFFFFF" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:0.5pt">- Access www.voteproxy.com and follow the <font style="white-space:nowrap">on-screen</font> instructions or scan the QR code with your smartphone. Have your proxy card
available when you access the web page. </font><br/><font color="#FFFFFF" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:0.5pt">Vote online until 11:59 PM EST the day before the meeting. MAILSign, date and mail your proxy card in the envelope
provided as soon as possible. </font><br/><font color="#FFFFFF" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:0.5pt">IN PERSONYou may vote your shares in person by attending the Annual Meeting. </font><br/><font color="#FFFFFF" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:0.5pt">GO <font style="white-space:nowrap">GREENe-Consent</font> makes it easy to go paperless. With <font style="white-space:nowrap">e-Consent,</font> you can quickly access your
proxy material, statements and other eligible documents online, while reducing costs, clutter and paper waste. Enroll today via www.astfinancial.com to enjoy online access. </font><br/><font color="#FFFFFF" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:0.5pt">COMPANY NUMBER ACCOUNT NUMBER </font><br/><font color="#FFFFFF" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:0.5pt">IMPORTANT NOTICE REGARDING THE INTERNET AVAILABILITY OF PROXY
